DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Baseline Prostate-Specific Antigen Prior Antiandrogen Therapy Outcome PSA Lab Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical test result for a tissue kallikrein-related sequence enzyme used as biomarker for prostate cancer prior to treatment with agents that interfere with action of male sex hormones.:a PSA (prostate specific antigen) laboratory value.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Baseline Prostate-Specific Antigen Prior Antiandrogen Therapy Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical test result for a tissue kallikrein-related sequence enzyme used as biomarker for prostate cancer prior to treatment with agents that interfere with action of male sex hormones.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Baseline PSA Prior Antiandrogen Therapy Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: Baseline; an imaginary standard by which things are measured or compared.:Alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family). Frameshifted isoform 2 has a shorter distinct C-terminus. A serine protease in seminal plasma, PSA may function in liquefaction of seminal coagulum by (preferential Tyr-X) cleavage of seminal vesicle protein. Kallikrein proteases have diverse functions. Mounting evidence implicates kallikreins in carcinogenesis; some have potential as cancer biomarkers. The serum level of PSA is useful in diagnosis and monitoring of prostatic carcinoma. (from LocusLink, Swiss-Prot, OMIM, and NCI):Earlier in time or order.:Treatment with drugs used to block production or interfere with the action of male sex hormones.:a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A starting point to which things may be compared.
Prostate-specific antigen (261 aa, ~29 kDa) is encoded by the human KLK3 gene. This protein plays a role in both proteolysis and seminal fluid liquefaction.
A therapeutic regimen that utilizes pharmaceuticals to reduce serum levels of male sex hormones.
a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a PSA (prostate specific antigen) laboratory value.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Value; a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
